3: Ah... here it is.
...No one's here, it seems. I can probably just... put this here...
Ayla moves lightly, placing the fortune bag with the couplets on the table.
Looking around, she can hardly find a flattering spot in the Strike Hawk's lounge.
It's not a good habit to judge others' aesthetics, but, still... sigh.
Sorry, Ayla, if this is too embarrassing. I simply prefer my lounge to be as simple as possible.
Ayla is not surprised to hear Chrome's voice behind her.
You're a captain. Defend yourself, at the very least.
I was the one who ordered the decorations to be taken down—Wanshi, the sleepyhead, kept hitting them when he woke up. It wasn't a big deal for Constructs, sure...
But as a captain, you're still worried... I see.

You're mistaken. Wanshi would use that as an excuse to avoid practice, so I spent some effort replacing all the decorations, and I put all these paddings on the edges and corners of the tables and chairs.
I... see... Oh, right. I almost forgot.
Ayla remembers why she is here and hands Chrome the bag she placed on the table.
I'm actually here on behalf of WGAA to give you this.
Is that so? Do I need to give you a receipt, or something? Allow me.
Eh, no? You misunderstood. Inside the bags is a pair of couplets from WGAA. They're like decorations for the festival, like... Christmas tree.
Chrome opens the bag and peeks inside, and he finds two pieces of red paper with words on them.
Couplets, you say? It's Lunar New Year, isn't it? My thanks to WGAA for preparing this.
Oh? How come you know what they are, Chrome?
I read about the festival in a book before. I was quite interested in this form of art, so I still remember bits of it.
Whoa, I'm so moved! If we can create another person like you, WGAA's effort will not be in vain!
That's... a bit hyperbolic, isn't it...
As the two of them talk, a tall Construct walks in, looking frustrated.
Capt... Why did you leave me behind... I got caught by old man Nik... I mean, Commander Nikola, and he gave me one hell of a talk...
You're right on time. Help me put these couplets up, won't you?
Seeing the red sheets in Chrome's hand, Kamui walks closer curiously.
What?! What are 'couplets'?
Chrome gestures to the running Kamui to lower his voice.
Kamui, Wanshi's probably sleeping, so don't wake him up.
What?! You mean there's someone else here? But... I was knocking, and nobody answered!
Oh, hi, Ayla! We've met, I think—long time no see!
...Looks like we can skip the introduction. And you're right—our third member is here, indeed. But it's that time of the day.
That time of the day?
...For him to sleep.
A Construct in sleep mode, is it? No wonder no one answered.
Wanshi does that a lot, so don't mind it. By the way, can I open this? Does it come with gifts like the red envelopes?
Kamui grabs the fortune bag from Chrome as he speaks and looks inside with anticipation.
Of course! It's for you!
With a bit of rustling, Kamui opens the bag and looks at the beautifully written couplets in his hands, his head tilted in confusion.
It's just... pretty red paper, Capt.?
And there are only two pieces, but... there are three of us!
This isn't a gift for us personally. They're decors for the room.
It's a tradition from the ancient East. Although we're still not sure what their application is, the words written on them are all beautiful blessings.
In the past, the people in the East would put these couplets up outside the door during Springtime as a way to wish for good luck in the coming year!
Ah, I see! If this will make our dreams come true... Capt., Ayla, can I decide where to place it?
I don't need it in my room, so... it's fine by me.
How about you, Ayla? Please let me handle this!
I'm supposed to give it to you to handle it, so of course—you have your captain's permission. You can do it.
Capt., Ayla, I will make sure to put the couplets and their intentions to good use!
Kamui grins as he walks toward Wanshi's sleeping pod.
An item to make our dreams come true... Obviously, it belongs to the one who sleeps the most!
